column5: Nice set-up Terry!...when do you wanna get out and swap some back lakes...lol..  Sorry for straying off the topic!!

Those Lund boats are sure great looking boats!  Wayne, looking at your Lund set up makes me drool! haha.  I recently purchased a full windshield Starcraft Starfire 170 but haven't taken possession of it yet.  I fished out of an older bass boat last year (my first boat).  I'll get some pictures up of the new ride later in the year.
Hey TMH,  I am doing fine, I am sure we will cross paths in the fall.  -sheldon
14ft Lund Laker w/30hp Mariner. Muskie, Bass, Pike.    Beauty shot discophish!

well here is my baby I sold last year...I still cry at night over it....sniff sniff one of 2 folding boats I have 2 of 2 I don't have a good picture of my new boat.. but it does suit the type of fishing I am doing now.......I like to fish for all types of fish
Here's mine i will be picking it up the end of april i fish for every thing as long as i am on the water it's all good   Rob
I still think we should have put the engine in that crate, on the fork truck, on the boat instead ! Would'a made a mean air boat !
LOL I bet it would

Well, here is my ride, it's nothing fancy and it is getting up there in years but it gets me out on the lake and back when I want to go. I'd like to buy something with a full windshield but can't afford a new one right now. Perhaps if I win the Super Seven or something but for now this will just have to do. I mostly fish for walleye but will fish for anything, as long as I am fishing I'm happy!    Andy looks a little ticked off here because he just wants to fish, the only problem I have with him is if I try to throw anything back, he wants to retrieve it. Andy just doesn't believe in catch and release LOL.
my 21' seaswirl striper with a 175 johnson.    my 8 footer i found on the beach with a 2 horse evinrude  that i tow to the lake with my lawnmower when i cant go salmon fishing!

Nice pics   live2fish  I used to do the great lakes for many years with a 23' FourWinns Fisherman.Caught many a big Chinook back in those years. Towed it around to all the derbies. Had a great time, just loved it. Now I mostly fish up north at my camp.
if you wanna get out look me up:)

Boat #1 16' Crestliner, 60hp merc, still need to get riggers, install the gps/sonar, need to install rod holders, pic doesn't include the 5hpkicker, or the powerdrive that i stole from boat #2       Boat #2 14' Lowe, 20hp merc, stole things from here to put into boat #1, hehe.

Thanks for the offer, I just might take you up on  that. I have to put a new dock in at my camp and build two small buildings this spring, so I will be labouring for a while this season. Fishing will be limited the first couple months, but will be on Lake for sure at some time.
Nice rig,take your time and do it right. I have two Big Jon Captains Pac downriggers(brand new) I will be listing. They won't be dirt cheap but less than new for sure, if interested let me know.
I may have mislead some with the picture of my boat. I just reposted the picture and have identified my boat in it.
DANG Pete...how am I gonna land on that one?

Hi Lundguy,  I have a 1990 2255 Bayliner, rigged up for Salmon fishing, and great for over nights and weekends. This boat is for sale as I am looking to get one that I can fit into smaller lakes as well.

I hear ya. It was some of the best times I had in those seven years on the great lakes. lots of big fish,lots of rough weather,lots of cold winds,lots of rain, lots of sun,lots of hard work, lots of long,long days, but one hell of a great time that only a real fisherman would understand. Now I am enjoying lots of the same ,just different type of fishing.Still use down riggers for the deep down lakers on a couple those up northern lakes. Wish ya luck on your sale of the boat and future fishing en devours.  PS: what kind of rig are you looking at buying next?
[  Triton Tr-20 with a 200 Evinrude HO.  favourite specie -bass, but love to fish Walleye, Musky, Crappie ,Pike , trout, almost anything really.
Hey Sheldon....how you doing??....nice looking rig bud!!..I guess I 'll get a close up view when we meet up on Quinte this fall
..and yes.. it's running Slowpoke! lol  Fish for what ever bites and have the holders/equipment to pretty much cover it all.    Figure I'll have this one for the rest of my years...
I coulden't hear it over the crickets. The smoke on the other hand... you really should do something about that. Have you considered an ETEC? -Brian
16.5 Lund w/ 90 Yamaha, fish for Salmon/Trout on Lake Ontario, Muskie in the Kawarthas and elsewhere...

Hi Warren,  I mainly target Muskies and Walleye here on the Ottawa River, as well as Rainbows, Specks, Splake and Lakers on smaller in-land lakes...  1st boat is a 20' pontoon with a 40HP Tohatsu motor that stays on the river from ice out in the spring to first ice in the fall.    2nd boat is a 14' Smoker Craft with a 15HP Merc    3rd boat is my trusty lil 12'r that I've had for over 25yrs now....it's powered by a 40lb thrust Minn Kota Maxxum and is used on the small, hard to get to trout lakes..    The boat I've had my eye on for the past few weeks....
love them back lakes my boat sits an my atv

Here is my setup. 16' w/ Right side Console 2007 40 HP Merc - 4 stroke Lowrance 522 iGPS - FishFinder/GPS Combo Minn Kota All Terrain - 65 lb thrust  My most frequently fished-for species: 1) Bass 2) Walleye 3) Pike 4) Crappie
Here's a picture with my truck in it as well! (both my babies)

I run a 16.5' Crestliner Canadian with a 30hp 4stroke Jonson tiller. It tows great & is overall very efficient. Four years ago I originally bought this boat in mind to fish the lakes up at our trailer on the Kawarthas. But the last couple of seasons I have switched gears & have been focussing my efforts on the close to home trout, salmon & walleye of Erie & Ontario. Each year I have slowly been outtfitting the boat to make it more "big water friendly". Riggers, holders, GPS, a fixed mount VHF,.... I am very comfortable 5 miles offshore

LookinforWalleye,  What size & year is your Navigator? How do you like it? Hows it ride in choppy water? I've been thinking about upgrading to a Navigator 175.  Here's my current boat. '86 SeaNymph 145 FM, w/35 HP Force.
Check your in box.

Here's my rig....it's an older one but perfect for me. I love the old girl!  I bought this late last year and had been fixing it up. It's an 18'10 Bayliner BassTrophy with a 125 Force. I bought a 71lb motor guide trolling motor for it at BPS a couple of weeks ago.  ...come on May!  Lookinforwalleye......have you had much trouble with your Force engine?  If anyone knows where to get a windshield, please let me know. A company in the US are making this model but last I emailed them, they might not have it until later in the summer.  Cheers,  Paul
this is my gem that I am currently in the process of gutting and redoing the whole interior I put a 4 stoke 60hp yamaha on it since this pic was taken 16 foot crestliner viking

Glad to meet ya all and see what you do your favorite hobby in. This kind of helps us get through those winter blaws. I am getting the itch, more and more as the posts keep coming. Looking at all the toys in here makes me think I better take a little more cash to the sport show on Saturday.
1987 smokercraft pro angler with a 35 merc, it`s been parked as long as I have been, in the barn. Needs some repairs possibly for sale.

Just realized that I don't have a good pic of my boat. Most of the time is spent in a 18.5 Sea Swirl powered up with a 175 Evinrude. Been a great boat for me. Takes the Nipissing waves very well and NO CARPETS!!! Rinse the worm guts down and away we go again to see if we can catch a pickerel..

Don't post often, but this is a great way to get all geared up for the new open water season.  I fish for walleye and my 2008 rig is a Tracker Tundra 21 Team Edition with a OptiMax 250Pro XS and a 9.9 Pro Kicker.   -s
99 Sylvan with 35Johnson.
Zib has the Force I run a Yamaha.
Sorry about that LFW.  Eye-Tracker....I think I've seen you pulling this thru Belleville for the fall walleye. What a beauty!  Cheers
I have a 14' Sportspal transom with a 30lb electric trolling motor.   My other boat is a 9'6" kayak.   The best part is, I can get them both on top of my car. At the same time.
Paul,  Give P & A Plastics in Hamilton a call.... they are well know for doing boat windshields.  G
Thanks Gerritt....I've emailed them from their web page to see.  Cheers,  Paul

I am fishing a 1999 Princecraft 16'9" Pro Series with a 90hp Yamaha 4 stroke.  I am fishing for bass, lake trout and pike on the Lake of Bays.  I'd be happy to hook up with anyone that might be up that way.  I hope to be up there most of the summer.  Trout ...... very soon.
here's mine
Here's mine, fish pike, bass and walleye, and get out the downriggers for Salmon, Lakers and Rainbows.
Deano where is that that it some nice looking countryside
Just hold 'er steady when I come to fish with you Pete... I hate going around and wasting fuel!

Now thats one mean great lakes trolling machine I got one of those Big Jon 60' Long Arm Down riggers that would fit right on the deck  Shouldn't use too much fuel, just start her up and let her coast to a stop which should be the other side of the lake by then.
I can't wait!
Great pic disco phish!

You might have done this before, but since I am fairly new in here I thought I would acquaint myself with some of you and find out find out what others fish and what kind of boats you use.  I have a 18'6 Lund Fisherman , 16' Lund DLX and 12' Lund DLX. I have a camp up northeast of Sault Saint Marie and our lake has bass, pike , walleye ,whitefish and sturgeon. I fish salmon in the Great Lakes and fish walleye,pike and bass where ever I can, when I am able.I am 57 years old and do most my fishing up north. Like to get away from all the traffic.  How about everyone else?     LundGuy (Warren)

I have this beauty of a boat....LOL    This is my first boat, bought last fall....only had her out twice before she was winterized.  It's just a 14 foot tinny, with an 18hp Merc, but I'm looking forward to hitting Kawartha lakes this upcoming season to hunt down some bass, walleye, and maybe some muskie.  I'm not brave enough to take this out on the big lake for Salmon, but it'll be a great starter boat for bly and I.  It's not much, nothing compared to your setup, but it's a start!

Well at least we know why you're called "LundGuy" This is my new boat, a 1600 Fish Hawk SC. I am pretty much a catch as catch can kind of guy. But love the north (or near north I guess) and the typical Northern Ontario fishing. I am really looking forward to the start of the season. Jim

I fish out of a Alumacraft Navigator with a Yamaha 90 four stroke.My home lake is Lake Scugog where I have a trailer at Goreskis and I am there every weekend from May to October. I like to hook up the boat a few times a year and head up to Simcoe and chase smallies and I made myself a promise this year to get out more and try some different waters we`ll see how that goes given the predicted price of gas.
good job.We all have to start somewhere and you are better off than I was when I first started out.Its not the boat that makes the fisherman.
Glad to meet ya Jim, nice boat.Good make ,good name.Going to the show on Saturday just to get the fishing feeling back.
I usually stop in at Lake Simcoe once a year and collect a few perch for our year end BBQ.Nice boat , almost bought one last year, but my wife put a stop to my fleet.
CCM, did you get the boat off of a Kajiji site? It looks familiar from when I was looking earlier.

Lundguy its not the first time that this thread has been run  I currently have a Lund SSV 18.6 ft 50Hp four stroke Honda I just traded it it in for a Lund 1660 Classic and I will be keeping the same Motor.      This one will be gone soon.   This will be the New boat with more toys and finally a bow Mount electric Motor.I ordered this one in dark grey.   Boat number 2 is a 12 foot Tinny(Thornes) that comes with me camping when I can't bring the Lund.It has an 8hp 2 stroke Yamaha.    This well the wife won't let me sell it but I must admit I still fish out of the canoe.  I mostly fish for Walleye and love to catch Bass and Pike.  2 species I would like to catch this year is a Laketrout and a Muskie.  Lundboy send some pics.  Mike the Pike

Hey Mike ,hope this works . Heres my boats, the bigger one I have had for 3 years. The pics of the 16 and 12 are not my actual boats. I just got them. The 16 has a new 55 Terrova Minn Kota on it with a 25 Merc.I had to build a bow platform to install the electric motor .. My wife did a great job on the carpet. I will send a pic once I get it out. 12 footer has a 9.9 Merc. If these pics don't show up I will figure it out later on.
The aptly named "Filth Hound"    14 footer with a 9 1/2 on the back. It does the job just fine! And 30 bucks for a weekend worth of gas suits me just fine.
You got that right,good luck and nice to meet you Rich.

Hi Warren, we might be neighbours! Bradley & Millbank area for me, South London. I'm running an 18' Starcraft Center Console - riggers and mast - ready for muskie and salmon! I want to get out for some more bass and pike this year - casting arm is getting a little flabby! If you want to hook-up and tell lies, get in touch with me! -Brian  ...at the helm...

Picked ours up a few years ago.    Tracker Targa V17 WT.  90 HP 2-Stroke Merc.  That windshield sure is nice on the cold rainy Northern Ontario September days.   I've been hinting around about upgrading to a 4 stroke, but my better half says we don't get out enough to make it worth the money.  Typically we're after pike, musky, and bass ... depending on where we go. (Our two girls are just a bonus ..... man, I sure do miss my Airdale.    But - we just picked up another one a few weeks ago, so she'll be in the Lakair pics and report)

Hey Lund Guy , nice to meet you.I have a 19ft. Alumacraft at my home base on Lake Erie, ,a 14ft. Slyvan at my trailer on the West Arm of Nipissing where I do most of my fishing and a 12ft. tinny for fishing the crappie ponds around home. I am 62, retired, and refer to myself as a full time fishing bum. Maybe we will bump into each other this summer.

Got a new Legend 16 Xtreme (picking up the end of next month), a 8' for the beach at the cottage and a 14 foot tinny with a 6 HP Johnson.  I fish for mainly bass and pike in Long Point. But will be trailering it to Quinte for some Walleye this year.
hi lundguy 17pro-v 115/8 four stroke with tr-1  auto pilot home fishing eire/ontario/simcoe/grandriver/niagara  what ever wants to jump in the boat see you on the water
As a matter of fact I did!  Gotta love that site....LOL.
I've got an air mattress and like to go for Bluegills!!!

Here is my ride..  17' Polarkraft w/ 78" Beam  These pictures are from when I took her our for a test drive.. as you can see she is bare bones        I have been working on her and have done this to the bow section....      I have also added a trolling motor and the needed navigation lights     This Spring I will be adding the back floor, new GPS, New Fishfinder and a stereo system  After that my wife says I am done spending lol  G
This is my first boat.  Lowe Stinger 170.  Use it on the St. Lawrence and little lakes up near Bancroft.  I ussually fish for bass and pike.  The boat is also sometimes used for recreation.
16ft crestliner 45 johnson all i need now is a 70lb maxum and this dang ice to melt

17 ft Mako- 115 E tec I fish from the twin sisters out of Pointe au baril up to and as far as Kilarney Mountains any givin weekend for Pike, Bass,Muskie,and Pickeral ,and now I got 2 new Cannon riggers sitting waiting for her so Salmon Trout what ever else I can kill time for on Georgian Bay
2 tone, do you ever fish the reef out by Center island?  G
Center Island ???  not sure where that is Gerritt
